member.name: T:R2API.CustomElite
member.summary: Class that defines a custom Elite type for use in the game All Elites consist of an , an and a . An Elite can only spawn if its in one of the available (vanilla or custom). Please check the constructors docs for more information.

member.summary: Elite definition

member.summary: The TextureRamp for this elite, can be omitted

member.summary: Elite tier(s) that the eliteDef will be on.

member.name: M:R2API.CustomElite.#ctor(System.String,RoR2.EquipmentDef,UnityEngine.Color32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{RoR2.CombatDirector.EliteTierDef},UnityEngine.Texture2D)
member.summary:
Use to add your elite to the during startup, along with adding it to all the given .
It's recommended that you use or if you intend on adding this elite to any vanilla tiers to ensure correct tier placement, with custom tiers added as needed.
member.param: Token for the text before a characters name
List of all tiers that can spawn this elite.
Color ramp to be used in . Can be null.

summary.para: You can omit giving a value to , as it'll be filled in automatically by the game.

member.param: List of the can spawn in.
Color ramp to be used in . Can be null.

member.name: P:R2API.EliteAPI.Loaded
member.summary: Return true if the submodule is loaded.

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.Add(R2API.CustomElite)
member.summary: Add a custom elite to the elite catalog. If this is called after the inits then this will throw. shouldnt be empty if you want to see your custom elite appear in the game. You can also directly modify . Please check the constructors docs of for more information.

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.AppendCustomEliteTier(RoR2.CombatDirector.EliteTierDef)
member.summary: Allows for adding a new elite tier def to the combat director during runtime.
member.param: The new elite tier to add.

member.summary: Allows for adding a new elite tier def to the combat director. Automatically insert the eliteTierDef at the correct position in the array based on its
member.param: The new elite tier to add.
member.returns: Index inserted at, or -1 if the operation failed

member.summary: Allows for adding a new at the given index in
member.param: The new elite tier to add.
Optional index to specify if you want to insert a cheaper elite tier

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.GetEliteTierEnumerable(R2API.VanillaEliteTier)
member.summary: Used for ensuring correct tier placement when creating a new . When given , the list will also include in the result to ensure the elite doesn't stop spawning after stage 2.
member.returns: All vanilla that the elite can appear in, or empty for None.

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.GetHonorEliteTierEnumerable(R2API.VanillaEliteTier)
member.summary: Retrieves the honor compatible for the given tier. and will be changed to their Honor variants. Used for ensuring correct tier placement when creating a new . When given , the list will also include in the result to ensure the elite doesn't stop spawning after stage 2.
member.returns: All vanilla honor that the elite can appear in, or empty for None, Tier2 and Lunar.

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.GetCombatDirectorEliteTiers
member.summary: Returns the current used by the Combat Director for doing its elite spawning while doing a run.

member.name: M:R2API.EliteAPI.OverrideCombatDirectorEliteTiers(RoR2.CombatDirector.EliteTierDef[])
member.summary: The EliteTierDef array is used by the Combat Director for doing its elite spawning while doing a run. You can get the current array used by the director with
member.param: The new elite tiers that will be used by the combat director.
